=== Simple Tag on an image ===

[http://annotation-ontology.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/images/v2/Tag%20on%20image%20-%20Example%20-%20by%20Paolo%20Ciccarese.png]<br/>
_Figure 1: an example in which a couple of tags have been attached to an image_

[http://annotation-ontology.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/images/v2/Tag%20on%20image%20-%20Annotation%20Ontology%20-%20by%20Paolo%20Ciccarese.png]<br/>
_Figure 2: two free text tags attached to a digital image identified by a URI. The nature of the annotation is specified through the Annotation Type ao:Tag._

The RDF of the example in picture 2 would look like the following: 

{{{ 
<rdf:Description rdf:about="http://my.example.org/ann/21304"> 
   <rdf:type rdf:resource="&ao;Tag"/> 
   <!-- The following can be added for querying with SPARQL 
   <rdf:type rdf:resource="&ao;Annotation"/> 
   <rdf:type rdf:resource="&ann;Annotation"/> 
   --> 
   <ao:annotatesResource rdf:resource="http://tinyurl.com/3ecvhzu"/> 
   <ao:body>Maine</ao:body> 
   <pav:createdOn>2011-08-17</pav:createdOn> 
   <pav:createdBy rdf:resource="http://www.paolociccarese.info#me"/> 
</rdf:Description> 

<rdf:Description rdf:about="http://my.example.org/ann/21305"> 
   <rdf:type rdf:resource="&ao;Tag"/> 
   <!-- The following can be added for querying with SPARQL 
   <rdf:type rdf:resource="&ao;Annotation"/> 
   <rdf:type rdf:resource="&ann;Annotation"/> 
   --> 
   <ao:annotatesResource rdf:resource="http://tinyurl.com/3ecvhzu"/> 
   <ao:body>Harbour</ao:body> 
   <pav:createdOn>2011-08-17</pav:createdOn> 
   <pav:createdBy rdf:resource="http://www.paolociccarese.info#me"/> 
</rdf:Description> 
}}} 

=== Simple Tag on a document ===

[http://annotation-ontology.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/images/v2/Tag%20on%20text%20-%20Example%20-%20by%20Paolo%20Ciccarese.png]<br/>
_Figure 3: an example in which a tag has been attached to an entire document_

[http://annotation-ontology.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/images/v2/Tag%20on%20text%20-%20Annotation%20Ontology%20-%20by%20Paolo%20Ciccarese.png]<br/>
_Figure 4: a text tag attached to a digital document identified by a URI. The nature of the annotation is specified through the Annotation Type ao:Tag._

The RDF of the example in picture 4 would look like the following: 

{{{ 
<rdf:Description rdf:about="http://my.example.org/ann/21305"> 
   <rdf:type rdf:resource="&ao;Tag"/> 
   <!-- The following can be added for querying with SPARQL 
   <rdf:type rdf:resource="&ao;Annotation"/> 
   <rdf:type rdf:resource="&ann;Annotation"/> 
   --> 
   <ao:annotatesResource rdf:resource="http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3102893/"/> 
   <ao:body>Web 3.0</ao:body> 
   <pav:createdOn>2011-08-17</pav:createdOn> 
   <pav:createdBy rdf:resource="http://www.paolociccarese.info#me"/> 
</rdf:Description> 
}}}
